title: A Note on Uncertainty Quantification for Maximum Likelihood Parameters Estimated with Heuristic Based Optimization Algorithms. (arXiv:2401.07176v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: Gradient-based solvers risk convergence to local optima, leading to incorrect researcher inference. Heuristic-based algorithms are able to ``break free" of these local optima to eventually converge to the true global optimum. However, given that they do not provide the gradient/Hessian needed to approximate the covariance matrix and that the significantly longer computational time they require for convergence likely precludes resampling procedures for inference, researchers often are unable to quantify uncertainty in the estimates they derive with these methods. This note presents a simple and relatively fast two-step procedure to estimate the covariance matrix for parameters estimated with these algorithms. This procedure relies on automatic differentiation, a computational means of calculating derivatives that is popular in machine learning applications. translated_title: 关于使用基于启发式优化算法估计的最大似然参数的不确定性量化的注记。
translated_abstract: 基于梯度的求解器有可能收敛到局部最优解，导致研究者的推断错误。基于启发式算法能够“摆脱”这些局部最优解，最终收敛到真正的全局最优解。然而，由于这些算法没有提供近似协方差矩阵所需的梯度/海森矩阵，并且它们需要较长的计算时间来收敛，这往往使得研究者无法量化使用这些方法进行估计的不确定性。本注记提出了一个简单且相对快速的两步过程，用于估计使用这些算法进行估计的参数的协方差矩阵。这个过程依赖于自动微分，它是一种在机器学习应用中广泛使用的计算手段。通过一个简单的实证例子，展示了这个过程与自助法的优势，并展示了它们的相似性。
tldr: 本文提出了一种简单且快速的两步过程，用于估计使用启发式优化算法估计的参数的协方差矩阵，并展示了它相对于自举的优势。
en_tdlr: This note presents a simple and fast two-step procedure to estimate the covariance matrix for parameters estimated with heuristic-based optimization algorithms and demonstrates its advantages over bootstrapping.
